ny1s3Pqn7SsPLIxaJKTv3A.text: Phoned orders to go twice now and really don't care for the lady taking the phone orders. She is very rude. Her name is Sherri I believe. First time I asked if they have a family pack, she said yes and said it comes with 2 sides and she named all the sides. I asked for onion rings and baked beans. Her reply was "Honey we can't measure a pint of onion rings". THEN WHY DID YOU NAME ALL THE SIDES WHEN I CAN ONLY HAVE BAKED BEANS AND COLESLAW???? Second time she called me honey again grrrrrr... This time I ordered chicken tenders special. I asked if they could do half plain and half spicy dipped(btw spicy dipped not that great) she immediately asked me something else about the order. So I asked again thinking she was distracted and didn't hear my request. To which her reply was "honey you just asked that". WELL OK WHY DIDN'T YOU RESPOND WITH A YES OR NO???? She's extremely rude. Don't businesses know how important customer service is?? I will not order again from lancasters. Also when I picked up my order she immediately answered the phone when I was signing the receipt- I couldn't even ask for an extra ranch. Never going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States
Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States
Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States

G_ADP1AEM6X2If8Ry0VZkA.text: Let me start off by saying, this was my first visit to Lancasters. Until today, I had only had take out once, maybe six years ago. We decided to give Lancaster a try today. My boyfriend had been many times before. We arrived and were immediately seated. While looking over the menu, I noticed a good amount of the options had mushrooms in them. Me, being highly allergic, I had to choose something that didn't have mushrooms listed to be safe. It also narrowed down my choices quite a bit. I settled for the burger with the fried egg and a side of mac and cheese. The mac and cheese tasted like over cooked noodles and watered down cheese wiz. The burger had no taste and again, these cheese was a weird consistency. The waitress refilled our drinks, but never asked us how our food was. I only took maybe two bites of the burger and by the time she came around the burger was completely dissected. The bacon wasn't cooked and the egg seemed like it had been siting under a heat lamp. When the yolk came out, it was already filmed over. We had our plates filled with trash, the server offered us refills once more yet, didn't pre bus. Or upsell desserts or ask if we were ready for our check, just disappeared

NvK9iUJin-Z3YR7Uca8Eig.text: Stopped by the restaurant by word of mouth. I had the chicken tender special which came with 2 sides and tea all for $7. It filled me up and had to have a to go box. I tried the barbalo sauce and it was great!!! Great service and great food. Will definitely come back again!

VkkpJPHsTqMn_kkkyGtAoA.text: Everytime my parents visit charlotte this is the place they always request we go.  I have been here with megan j. Alot as well and we have never had a bad experience. The service is on the slow side yet 100 percent worth your wait. I usually order the pp platter or brisket with Jamaican honey wings with a side of mac and cheese. Coming from a mac and cheese fanatic id say their's is some of the best.  Recently they seemed to have done some work to the interior which in my opinion was a downgrade. They took out all the racing stuff and cool signs they had up to exchange for a much more modern setting. Oh well. The place rocks.

RI3dXsWTTmHExPVeYcD7hg.text: When you think NC Bbq, you think a basket piled full of smokey shredded pork goodness. I don't suggest you fill your mind with those thoughts before you visit here. I got the Bbq pork tray ($7.99) and was very disappointed at the portion... it looked like a kids plate. Needless to say I wouldn't have been satisfied if I wouldn't have devoured the hush puppies prior to getting my meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States. 7.99 pork tray

VuLNGzsF0S7FnR1ifJ2KyQ.text: Had a hankering for some good BBQ while visiting my fiance's parents down here in NC, and we brought in take-out from Lancaster's. I got the BBQ pulled pork dinner, with Mac n cheese and BBQ slaw; the vinegar BBQ sauce was quite tasty with the pork, the Mac n cheese was pretty good, and the BBQ slaw was yummy. I even tried some of the Brunswick stew, which is quite filling and couldn't finish it, but it was good.  Too many good choices on the menu, will have to try some of the other offerings when I'm back down this way.

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States. Pretty darn good BBQ in NC!

033wYEvabREm1xqI7H_mSg.text: Being in Charlotte for work I happened by this place when I was headed back to the hotel after spending some time at the Latta Plantation.  I had not had barbeque in a while so I thought I would give this place a shot.  I know bbq is different in various parts of the country so I went in here with an open mind.  I got my food to go so I am allowing some leeway for that.  I had brisket and pork ribs with sides of potato salad and Brunswick stew with funnel fries for desert.    I will start with the good which was the potato salad.  It was really good and had a good dill flavor to it which I like.  The Brunswick stew was ok, good and hearty but could have used a little more salt.  Now the rest, I may be jaded being from Austin which has so many good bbq joints and the cooking style is different.   A barbeque dinner is not complete without brisket so I had to have some.  What I saw when I opened my package is something I have never witnessed with sliced brisket before.  The slices had grill marks on them!  I couldn't help to keep from chuckling when I saw that.  They were obviously fresh off the grill.  The sauce on them was good and had a good flavor.   The pork ribs in my opinion had been boiled and then smoked.  The way the meat fell off the bones was not typical to smoked ribs.  They had the same good sauce on them.  The funnel fries would have been good if there was more than a dash of powdered sugar on them, for what I paid for the meal, they could have been more liberal in applying sugar on the desert.    To sum up this may be a good barbeque joint in North Carolina but it would never survive against the competition back home in Austin.

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States. You would lose your bbq license in Texas if you grilled brisket.

Bv0vgnlR2lGllzIWayZPOw.text: This is local treat! Great BBQ and the sides are so delicious. Collards greens and Mac and Cheese like grandma used to make. Fast service! They have a store in Mooresville too.

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States. To go zone

iYshv5ZsQ475PfT8u7pYDg.text: I've been going to Lancaster's for a while now and although I've had the off meal or two, all in all, I am a fan of this place.  Due to the fact that I work fairly close to Lancaster's, I try to get takeout as much as I can.  My go-to-meal is the BAR-BA-LO wings which are legendary around these parts.  Their ranch, when you can get it cold, it above par as well.  We've all heard of the magical Bar-ba-lo wings that many places claim to have originated.  Well, I don't know if Lancaster's Bar-Ba-Lo's were the first, but they sure are the best!  The wings are always meaty and dripping with loads of sauce.  Of course you always have the option to ask for them extra crispy.  Me personally, I love them how they come.    *Kid's cheeseburger is legit - very cost effective, yet filling.  It comes with fries.   *Cobb and Maui Salads are excellent.  I usually add a hard-boiled egg onto each. *BBQ sandwich is good, comes with a side of BBQ sauce (vinegar) and slaw.   *I have never had the brisket personally, but I've been told by coworkers that its phenomenal.   To me, its better to take your food and go if you have that option available. Sometimes the waitress service can be spotty and it can take a while to get your meal during lunch time.  The to-go area is always quick and the service is always great.    Lancaster's is not a world beater when it comes to BBQ, especially in such a hot-bed of 'QUE.  With that being said, its definitely worth a try and is probably the best BBQ option in the immediate area.

Ao-kV5rWtyzZgrlrB-dUUA.text: Hubby and I have started finding excuses to visit the Charlotte area just so we can come to Lancaster's for barbeque. For example, we were in the area for a convention this past weekend, so we stopped here for lunch on Friday. One way to tell a good barbeque joint? The local cops are eating here. When we arrived, there were three separate groups of law enforcement eating here.  So, for lunch, hubby had a platter that had pulled pork and fried chicken. I had a lunch plate with just the pork. We also both had sweet tea and, of course, hushpuppies! Everything was tasty and cooked perfectly.  Our server was friendly and efficient. This was our third or fourth visit and we will be back!  Oh, they have updated their decor a bit since we were there last in November. Looks good!

0HbxrI85EuLWY77dgflThw.text: The people here are really nice but there is nothing special about the food.....the wings(dry), tenders(not seasoned), fish(blah), hush puppies(ok).....all average.  That being said, I will probably never go back here for the food but I will return for the funnel cake sticks that simply blew my mind!  And to think I almost missed out on this special treat....a young lady came in to order 'funnel cake sticks' and that was it, she then looked at me and advised me to do the same.......and I did.......yummy, the best decision I had made that day!

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States. Funnel cake sticks

0jOht-tiukB_I0ty0u2Wag.text: Try their ribs! They also give you hush puppies when you order an entree. Just make sure you still have space for your main course.

l2_QIuGDCNlk9dnkDog_Iw.text: Amazing ribs and brisket. Nice staff. Full bar.  Kid friendly place that has a large dining room and some claw machines to distract children at a price.

hRdZAOx_xTHGD8NyLmUbQg.text: Good to stop here if you're a race fan - great memorabilia on display. This place essentially runs on tourists. The eastern NC style BBQ leaves a lot to be desired. Under seasoned meat. Plastic and stodgy Mac and cheese. Sauces are decent, as are the free hush puppies that come with every meal. Sweet tea is good and refreshing too. However, one visit was good enough for me.

2rJT49PMjxyuusUQ825Etw.text: First time at the resterant.  We came right at lunch, but were sated promptly.  The menu was full of good options.  Our server was helpful with the menu and recomendations. The BBQ was very good. Would recomend the resteraunt.  The prices were on the higher side forlunch.

165zOr5JYb3JnlgXQA2JKA.text: These people SO get it!  My company has used them for catering and they truly understand the meaning of the word.  They're easy to deal with, they're reasonably priced and they have amazing follow through.  If you need an event catered, CALL LANCASTER's BBQ!  You will NOT be sorry!

cJipObYTAlqb0u59L9L1NQ.text: Lancasters is good solid Carolina style BBQ. Folks from Texas or other states probably won't get it.   I'll admit their brisket is a little odd with grill marks on it but I have gotten it before and it's good. Their ribs are decent but again their thing in my opinion is Carolina BBQ.  If you go here get pulled pork BBQ and you should be good to go. Also their wings are really great if you are into that. Fried catfish is pretty darn good as well.   Enjoy and have some hushpuppies!

Fd3JkOXgpVL5yz99tiwHxw.text: Kept hearing that they had some of the best bbq in Charlotte. Bbq was very dry. The rest of the food was average. The biggest complaint was the service. We ordered. Got our food. And never saw our waitress again. Dry bbq plus no drink left a bad taste in our mouths. Won't be back.

adAj_ct_Iur1-yScGlpb-A.text: Have had some 4 star meals here and some 3 star meals but the former have been outweighed the latter thus the rating of 3 for this review.  If you don't stray too far from the Eastern NC style pork, you will generally walk away relatively satisfied.  It's some of the other things on the menu where the adventure begins.  The fried catfish is usually very good.  The wings however are a real crap shoot.  No matter where I go, I ask for wings to be well done or extra crispy.  I don't care if the meat inside is on the dry side, I just don't want soft, non-crisp skin on them.  Lancaster's misses the mark more often than not. Including on my most recent visit this past Saturday.  On this visit I got a half and half wings/pork combo.  As usual, the pork was good with mostly lean, pretty well smoked meat but the wings a soggy mess.  Aside from the limp skin, they were way under-seasoned and bland.  Tasted mostly like grease even with the buffalo sauce they were shaken in.  The creamy coleslaw for a side was also in need of a good dose of salt and pepper.  The onion rings though... Out of this world good.  Light, very crispy batter.  Obviously cooked to order and served piping hot and delicious.  Some of the best O-rings I've had in Charlotte.  Lancaster's is what it is and as long as it continues in the A-OK 3 star or better range, I'll be back as it is a low key, casual atmosphere and I enjoy just a quick bite at the bar every once in a while.  Just remind me to go for the catfish and skip the wings!

H9sBYgoTpiHkGai0ku1HfA.text: As an East Carolina BBQ fan I was eager to try this out.   The pulled pork is done just right and the vinegar based sauce (add yourself) is great.  The bbq slaw (mustard based) is a perfect addition.   Brunswick stew takes me back to Parkers in Rocky Mount.  Only wish the stew portion was larger!   Will definitely come back if in the area.

N1uqQPVNxQCFCrnUYi07tg.text: We have driven by this place so many times, we decided to stop by and try it. From the outside, clean and well kept exterior. Just looks like one of those family owned joints with good homecooked food. Our server was nice, seemed new but did a good job. Our appetizers were nothing amazing but the fried pickles were tasty. Our entrees however were terrible. I read that the brisket was great so I gave it a try. Awful... dry, and about a 5oz portion. My sides of Mac and cheese and Brunswick stew were literally that of a child's portion. Nothing had but flavor, I had to salt everything. Not impressed and probably won't be back.

G-HqLkv3-bt2Ak1Qo4gZFQ.text: The BBQ was not that great especially for the price. Overall in Charlotte/LKN area there aren't that many BBQ joints but some are definitely better than others. Try Midwood.

2t0Kt07U6hZVPEmmGJHjvw.text: A 3 1/2 star. Only 2 different sauces. Prices ok. Huge buns for sandwiches. Will try again sometime.

t8RilQ_mYD_QPHIVNA5ibg.text: Pretty darn good barbecue. Best place I have found in Charlotte. The brisket is Delicious and my favorite. The Jamaican honey wings are to die for. They give you free hush puppies to start which is nice. The service is just really slow but worth it for Fresh food. The environment is very casual and fun. I would recommend especially for the price!

SQrJ6jfm5UkSlf05YEpbSQ.text: We are at the nearby raptor center and stopped by for much with the two grandkids. Decent Childers menu and chocolate milk so the kids were happy. My husband had chicken finger which were what you would expect. I have the pulled pork which was good but I thing it had been reheated in a liquid. The Cole slaw was good. The BBQ sauce on the table was unlabeled so it was a bit of trial a miss. Service was efficient but not friendly. It was clean. Overall a decent place

UlOoTA908EsMJiL-isHrOQ.text: The pork BBQ was dry with very little smoke flavor. The sauces (Eastern NC Vinegar and a smoky Memphis-style) were actually pretty good. The mac-n-cheese tasted like the sauce came from a can. The Brunswick stew was OK, but nothing special. The "Banana pudding" was just commercial pudding with a few banana slices and dry vanilla wafers mixed in - nothing like traditional baked banana pudding.  This is our 2nd visit and likely our last.

7lEeB6I4CUJGMkSRWTKcdA.text: It felt like eating a school lunch when the food was served, except school lunch tasted better. Lots of foam-plates, bowls, etc. Mac and cheese tasted like a tv dinner, mashed potatoes were bland. There are better restaurants around for the same price.

3yrEaA8ALC7mbYBDk-gNwg.text: If you have read any of my reviews for other BBQ restaurants then you know I don't put a lot of stock in BBQ reviews.  BBQ is a religion and very regional.  There are significant differences just in North Carolina alone.  You love what you grew up with and everybody else's BBQ is an abomination.  Now I have ate BBQ all over the South and have an appreciation for most of it.    My pulled pork plate was a little dry but I will cut them some slack.  It was late and we probably were getting pulled pork smoked from earlier that day.  The sides are decent.  They have an extensive menu for a  BBQ place.  This is not a pork only joint (pulled pork, ribs).  They have smoked brisket, chicken and fried catfish on the menu.  They also have two different sauces on the table (vinegar and catsup based).  You can also choose between BBQ and mayo slaw.  Decent beer selection if you need alcohol (and who doesn't).  It's all in bottles but hey that's not a problem.  My only rant, and it is with most BBQ place in NC, is I hate the dog turd hush puppies.  I need to send someone from Arkansas, Tennessee, Louisiana, or Mississippi to teach y'all how to make hush puppies.  1) Hush Puppies are round and 2) Y'all need to add some more spices, or maybe some chopped onions.   If you are devilish, some chopped jalapenos.  These dog turds appear to be nothing but 1/2 cornmeal, 1/2 flour and maybe some sugar.    Highly recommend Lancaster's.

IeLXeHLtHpOrh1dyy2K_Lg.text: I received a recommendation to visit this place from the trail guide while horseback riding at Latta Plantation Equestrian, so I decided to give it a try.  My friend and I arrived around 2:30ish pm, and there was not many patrons inside.  We were greeting by a friendly server (Lakanjelia), who directed us to our seats and took our drink orders.  Lakanjelia came back shortly after with some hushpuppies (which happened to be one of the few good items we ate during our visit), and took our orders.  My friend ordered the blackened fish and shrimp combo with baked beans and fried corn and I orderd the brisket and rib combo (rib was not for me) with "seafood salad" and mac&cheese.  After going through two baskets of the good hushpuppies, the food orders finally arrived.  I immediately gave my friend the rib, as I do not eat pork, we prayed, and begin to eat.  My friend then noticed that the fish and shrimp was not blackened as order, however, we decided not to bring that up to the waitress.  I then look at my "seafood salad" which was lacking any signs of seafood and the mac&cheese seemed to have come straight out of a box!  I mentioned this to the waitress, who kindly informed me that the "seafood salad", although called "seafood salad", does not actually have "seafood" in it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Are you freaking kidding me!!  Why name it that?  Is it in an attempt to bamboozle customers, Is it that the owner/creater of the menu does not know what a "seafood salad" is???????  The ever so friendly waitress asked if I wanted another side in the place of the "seafood salad" in which I immediately said yes, I will have the collard greens.  When the collard greens arrived they looked more like turnip/mustard greens (soggy, not well defined, nor fresh).  I took a bite of the collard greens and they also tasted burnt!!!  Next I bit into the brisket (which seemed to be overcooked) and it was very dry and the flavor resembled ham moreso than beef brisket.  I am no expert on brisket, however, I have eaten plenty of brisket from many different restarants/food establishments in the past and have never, I repeat, NEVER tasted any as worse as this one!!!  I mentioned this to the waitress and she went and informed who I presumed was hte manager.  He came over to the table with an arogance about him and stated "I was told you did not like your food, what is/was wrong with it?"  I kindly explained to him how I felt about the brisket and the collards.  He then walked off and came back shortly stating "I am not comping your entire meal, which I never expected him to do so because the ribs (which was said to be good, per my friend) were ate.  When the bill came, it had a note on top stating "Customer Didn't Like Brisket tasted Burnt it wasn't" - MT.  I have never, in all my years dining out, received a comment such as that on any bill, as a result of me, the customer voicing my honest opinion on food I ordered, and would have had to pay for, given I did not like it!!!  The nerves of this guy!!!    I am sure anyone reading this was able to determine that I will NEVER, EVER return to this restaurant, nor will I RECOMMEND IT to anyone!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States. When have you ever received a bill with this on top because you were not satisfied with the food you were paying for???!!!

m0_hGXYr9rXlEIVhkFCqrg.text: Had the BBQ & Brisket combo. Generous portions and very good Q. Will be back for more!

A1XV988U_qspnYATZ85yKw.text: Although the wings were good, the brisket was horrible. It had to have been sitting for days. When the waitress asked how was everything, I shared my thoughts on the brisket.  She said she'd let them know in the back. Too bad, this place was good in the past. Wonder what has changed?

jtFIvSkQzYKK0aw7tLDs9g.text: We love the food and the service! Definitely recommend.  The banana pudding is great. Bar-B-Q is so wonderful  you will want to take your friends. We did.

PfEdh_oLdgzdQLxaLoRkrw.text: Had Redneck Nachos... Was not served as what was listed on the menu... no lettuce, tomatoes, sour cream, and every bite of the brisket was fat not meat! The worst nachos I have ever had. My husband ordered World's Greatest Buffalo Wings were cold.

kJpp-V2Okg4Sw-jORL9UYQ.text: This review is for their take out.  Ordered the BBQ pulled pork which was very tasty. The Beef Brisket was delicious. The bread was toasted with cole slaw spread on top of the brisket slices. Yummy. The French fries filled my craving for the day. Will be back for lunch/dinner the next time.

BbOn0b0gHys2PiFwpHaDdw.text: Awesome ribs. Great BBQ and their sauces are pretty good too. It's just a small place but really clean and very friendly staff. Very pleased with my experience. Would recommend it to anyone wanting a good meal.

uEIcMnBQ9sdyKco34fVoaA.text: The Jamaican Honey wings are de-li-cious!!!!!  I did not like the salt & pepper catfish; and will stay away from the fish from now on no matter how it's made.    I still have to try to BBQ chicken salad.

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States. Catfish platter with Jamaican Honey wings

jZFU9ixPdYexDzcEVEEY8w.text: Newer to the area and this place happens to be right down the street and i absolutely love the pulled pork! All the sides are excellent. Service is always good and everyone is so friendly. Usually stop in here at least a couple times a month and we've brought a handful of visitors from out of town here as the bbq is wonderful. You cannot go wrong with the fresh hush puppies you get as a bonus while waiting for your meal. Definitely a worthwhile stop if you are in the area!

eKHWpqahwoCe-Gq-1BtZKg.text: Great pork BBQ and chicken tenders. Great place to go with a group. Staff is always friendly.

uFRtHDGL51uWomUd65oXPQ.text: I was waiting for two weeks to try this spot. Being from Boston you would think I don't know my BBQ. WRONG!!  This spot is fantastic. Ribs were perfect, fall off the bone. Mustard based slaw was great. Mac n Cheese was a little mushy but the warmth of the staff, the fantastic BBQ, cold beer....it is easy to overlook the Mac. Thank you for a great meal, I'll be back next time I am in town.

3r7SeEXkPD8I_DP6-Vra-g.text: The brisket was terrible. I've tried brisket across the country at many BBQ restaurants and this was a poor excuse for good beef.   The saving grace was the okra and mashed potatoes. The waitress was also vet nice.  Unfortunately it's not enough to repeat business from me.

i1yKeN7Pfd3tadys8yCxng.text: Odd. I thought this place was pretty well respected for its BBQ fare.   Ribs were overcooked. Fall off the bone is nice, but not fall to pieces and get delivered in a pile of mixed bone and meat. Sauce was old. No smoke flavor. At all.   Brisket was the same. Moosh. Nasty coagulated fat. No smoke ring, no smoke. Dry. Food service grade meat per the coarse grain with the marble cooked out of it.   Fried okra; moosh. Tasteless.   Mac and cheese was tasty, but swimming bechamel.   Best thing I had was.......the Texas toast.   Visited at 7:15 pm on a Thursday. Pretty empty.   Maybe the other location(s) are up to speed but this visit reeked of par cooked nasty.

GXkjnshVFbiOKyIaWS-Gag.text: My boyfriend and I are in NC for the first time and stopped by this restaurant based on reviews. Guess what,  It was all that  and more. Great food, excellent service, and yummy mushrooms! We ate fried mushrooms, Cobb salad, ribs, baked beans, ribs, and Jamaican honey wings.

N_cTWo_0ivbGZMFT1PwYKg.text: Brisket and chicken wings were good. Sides were good. The fried mushroom were expensive for the amount but were tasty. The Brunswick stew reminded me of dog food for some reason.. Maybe the smell. The bar tender stared at me from the time I walked in until I walked out which was a little uncomfortable. A neighbor suggested the place so I went to pick up. I plan to go again to pick up.. I would never eat inside.

wLO90tlls6qAdOOlPYeccg.text: One of my favorites. Food is always good. Catering is easy and customizable. Great wings, ribs and pork bbq.

RtAuSFyG0zhMY3CW2S8Qfg.text: Let me start off by saying "WOW".  I first thought this was some hole in the wall bbq place in NC but then I was truly shocked about how great the food was.  I don't eat too much friend chicken but the way they cook/season there chicken is like no other.  Then you got these sources they dip the chicken in was is just amazing.  We order a half of chicken dipped, coleslaw, bang bang shrimp and a cake.  I enjoyed every bit of it so much that I went back the next day.  The next time I'm in charlotte again I'm hitting this place up for sure.  The customer service was also just a good and very friendly people who take the time to explain/discuss the menu with you.  I can't wait to go back ahhh that chicken was so good!!!!!!!!!!!!

yhMeDzADfNOtF7oSHHBWEA.text: I have eaten here three times now, and once at their mooresville location.  Love the food, always get good service, place is clean, prices are reasonable.  The beef brisket and the hushpuppies are my two favorite things, but I've liked everything I've had here.  Definitely a regular stop for me when I want BBQ.

8KebXbqetZP7rRaN_G_rdw.text: Fun atmosphere. Good staff and great food. Try the buffalo shrimp wrap! Delicious!

kO1FwkzOtbXlQ0BPVJGdbQ.text: Tonight, I tried the Chic-A-Que, a fried chicken breast sandwich with pork barbeque with barbeque sauce. I'm a fan and I'll be back.

G7zPXsV2h4YPBSdy2J1WAQ.text: All around a good meal! Free hush puppies!! Then we had the red neck fries! DELICIOUS! Pulled pork sandwich DELICIOUS! Service was good and fast...only bad thing was the Mac and cheese and it was maybe a 4 on a scale of 1-10...

kUYt98eU0OZLpCnaTtbbvA.text: Lancaster's new location on Beatties Ford Rd. continues the legacy of great NC style bbq and wings with a decor that is decidedly southern.  Long a Mooresville staple,  the spacious new digs sees Lancaster's spreading south, near Exit 18 and the Northlake Mall area.  The interior is what you would expect from a southern bbq and wing joint in the heart of NC: NASCAR memorabilia, farm equipment signage such as John Deere ads, and an impressive collection of signs denoting various gasoline brands.  It definitely offers a bit of old-school charm and nostalgia, harkening back to simpler times when a community was a community and gas was well under a $1. But I digress...  The food, as always, is typical Lancasters. Great bbq, great wings. I ordered a bbq and chicken finger sammich...that's bbq with chicken on the same bun. Kind of an odd combination, but excellent.  The hush puppies are a must-order as well.  Wednesdays are Bike Night at the new location, and there are plenty of rows of video games to entertain the kids while you saddle up to the bar and talk Harley-speak with the clan that just rolled through the door.

LVrEkOCLqsNHS3mMbo6HNg.text: I can't really speak for their BBQ but they have excellent Chicken wings. Everyone else I was with had BBQ and chicken and even some shrimp for a app. When you dine in here they bring you a basket of complimentary hush which in and of themselves are pretty good but not crazy outstanding. Our service was a little on the slow side but no ones orders were messed up and the staff is very friendly. They also have a couple BBQ sauces on the table you can try but they seemed to be mostly vinegar without a lot of character. Still not bad but definitely not great either. Price was not really cheap, I'd say more along the lines of "moderate" but the quality of the food was pretty good so I guess you can say it's a decent value. If you are a fan of chicken wings for sure check this place out.

BHlb_8U9qtTAd0rhV4amRQ.text: We had some family in town and wanted to take them somewhere for BBQ.  So we searched Yelp for reviews of local BBQ and we found Lancaster.  I got the pork dinner tray, my husband and mother-in-law got their chicken and my father-in-law got the ribs.  Everything was great, but I have to say that my favorite after having a sampling was their chicken with the spicy sauce.  Oh my!  that chicken was awesome!!!!!  My husband and I both thought it was the greatest we ever had and we are eager to come back to try their wings.

SAZRLTRB2ZD1uoPVJbnoBg.text: Had a chance to check out Lancasters last week from some BBQ take-out. Have driven past this place for years and never stopped in. Located on Beatties Ford just north of Mount Holly-Huntersville Road, it's easy to miss. There's a restaurant side and a bar side, which is where the take out area is. Very friendly staff. Ordered the chicken/pork combo and it was decent. Nothing wowed me about it, but it was pretty good. The mac & cheese side was really good though and I'd recommend that. Good place for a quick lunch and I can see why this is a 5pm place for many workers. Pork was better than the chicken, so if I go again, I'll probably just go with the pork platter.

VmMBWzUJSuOfKbGSO9UhBg.text: We grab take out at least twice a month. The food is consistently good. My husband likes the BBQ and wings. I'm pleased with the grilled chicken salad. You can never go wrong with the friend okra, served whole instead of cut.

ShqGD1qayx3d60jx8TYipw.text: We have been eating at the Lancasters in Mooresville forever and couldn't wait for the South location to open.  It is always hard to decide between the ribs, wings and pork so I have to do a combo to make it easier.  Their fried mushrooms are a must get and it tough to pick them over the o-rings b/c they're the best in the area.  Both locations have great food but the staff at the South location isn't as good as the original in Mooresville. Even when the locations look like they will be packed or there are people standing outside, there is always a table available with little to no wait, so don't drive away.  We enjoy taking family from out of state b/c they handle the large table seating requirements without delays. I believe others feel the same way and it is people like us standing around after the meal that make it look like we're waiting to be seated.

Vg8s3vq2Bxsiji_klEkWpQ.text: Pretty decent BBQ, standard BBQ beans at good prices! The vinegar slaw is FANTASTIC! Not what you would expect - The color is yellow which comes from the mustard & vinegar dressing with "pulverized slaw". We loved it. Just wish they had more choices of sauces. Friendly waitresses. The background music was scratchy and didn't seem to "fit" the style of this restaurant.

ua5rNu1dxCxXkqQwkKcTsA.text: It's not for me. The Mac 'n cheese did not taste homemade or fresh and for me that is a big no-no in the South. The pulled pork had way too much black pepper for my preference. Too bad, I just moved close by and wanted this place to be our go-to place for dinner out.

CTnCt2fMfx0ucJBe4zQk5Q.text: The food was good and the place is very convenient if you up in and around Huntersville, but the wait staff has a lot to be desired.  There are two few of them and easily overwhelmed.  And if you are not familar with the restaurant and the menu, they don't tend to be that helpful.  I would give it another try, but not going to go out of my way to recommend or rush back -

f7h0xHKQHkonhr60TLVsRw.text: Perfect example of BBQ done well. I have tried the pulled pork BBQ and numerous side dishes including the deep fried mushrooms and the onion rings, all are delicious. The tea is sweet, the hush puppies are plenty, and the prices are low. It is a great family place to eat until you fufill your gluttonous desires. I would definitely recommend Lancaster's BBQ for anyone looking for a great North Carolina BBQ experience.

uZ5RrccGk-h1walwWjfYPw.text: 3.5 stars The service was slow and still we had to ask for napkins and naps for the ribs. The food was awesome, from the jalapeno  chicken strips to the bar-balo chicken wings, would love a bottle of that bar-balo sauce! The ribs were fall off the bone, something  hard to find back here in San Jose. I still have dreams of the ribs and wished I Fred Flinstoned some in the car back with me to the airport on my way home!

ZIISbnHRMttlQ1frkg8V4g.text: Okra is awesome and free hush puppies hits the spot. Brisket is moist and wings are tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States. Inside
Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States. Inside

l2QsP6JJ_dVnWATmZpN-Sw.text: I tried this place while visiting in Charlotte. There was nothing bad with this restaurant or the food, but it was just average.

s_tUxcFYACGOwFGSUcS6Yg.text: Ordered take-out... 1/2 rack ribs, house salad, mac and cheese, mashed potatoes and onion rings. Ribs were tender but on the dry side. Mac and cheese had zero flavor (and I mean zero), onion rings had a bitter after taste as if they were fried in spent old oil. Mashed potatoes were pasty and dry. In fact I can swear they tasted like instant potatoes from a box!  This is the second time Ive eaten there and both times were far below average. I don't know how they stay in business.  PS, the house salad was pretty good.

pqH426GPovSDNaS-q8FDBw.text: We were in there area with a large work group, and decided to stop by.  plenty of seating for a large group or just you and the family.  once they take your drink order, they give you free hushpuppies, can't complain about that!  Im very picky when it comes to BBQ after moving from TX.  Its not Texas but its the best BBQ place I've found since moving here  Ordered the brisket sandwich with a side of beans.  not a large portion, perfect size for one with nothing to take home after.  Others at the table ordered chicken, salads, pork, wings.  All looked good.  Will definitely come back

6K4kvMh5E-n3f-LGrFLtyQ.text: Went to Lancasters after work on Thursday,  August 18th.  The food was good as usual,  but the service was terrible.  We had a young blonde waitress who had a terrible attitude. We asked what she recommended  and she said, "I don't know,  because I hate pork." It's a BBQ restaurant for heavens sake. Every time we asked her about something on the menu her response was crappy abd just said, "I don't know..." and was full of excuses.  I like the Lancaster' in Mooresville a lot better.

A2oV5Z7VQHyHOf0CZ9XTow.text: The prices and the friendly service alone makes this place a 4 star establishment.  Unfortunately,  the food brings it back down to a 3.  I had the fried chicken, and BBQ combo with a side of potatoe salad and green beans. The chicken was fried nice and crispy, but lacked any seasoning.  This was the problem with every dish I had.  No real flavor.  Everything was just ok.

z6fODrVUaUY9WC1rt7Rf8Q.text: It really depends on what kind of food you want. I would grade this at the level of KFC, but a lot of people love KFC. The food quality is on par with fast food. If you don't mind that, you will like this place.   Personally, there was nothing wrong with the food. It was "good". I just prefer higher quality food. But I'm going to rate it for what it is. So it will get four stars because it does not advertise as fine dining.   The green beans were clearly canned green beans (nothing wrong with that). The mac n cheese was like school cafeteria mac n cheese. The hush puppies were really good. The pork is fine. It's priced appropriately. Again, all good food. I ate all of it. It's your typical soul food.   The staff was friendly. The clientele was friendly. There were families there and your typical regulars tucked away and hanging out at the bar.

omRMPmlXWDpFIyu3dYARAg.text: Sub-par.  I think this place falls victim to the fact that when you sell bbq in a state known for bbq, the standards are higher.  They give you hush puupies for free and they're actully really good.    I ordered the baby back ribs/brisket combo with fried whole okra and mayo coleslaw.  This was an item labeled "market price" which was $18 for an August evening.  It was decent, but definitely not worth returning.  Now the okra was really tasty, but come on, its kind of hard to screw up.  The coleslaw was a bit sweet, but thats one of those things I'm just picky about, so no biggie.  But the meat - such a disappointment!  The ribs seem boiled and then tossed on the grill for browning & marking.  The brisket had grill marks on the slices and was very tough.  On the bright side they had the brown sugar/thick style bbq sauce in addition to the typical vinegar sauce.    This may be the type of place to come for a quick bbq sandwich because its close or you just don't know any better, but its definitely not the "go to" bbq spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States. Baby back ribs/brisket combo with fried whole okra and mayo coleslaw

G7Y9a7CQ_aF7xEAZTifr2w.text: I was so looking forward to eating here because of all of the great reviews I have gotten from friends here in North Carolina... The staff were very friendly, the place was clean and walking in it smelled great. I ordered the half rack of ribs with collards and fried okra, and was surprised to get a fresh basket of hush puppies as a pre-order. Unfortunately the hush puppies on the fried okra was the best part of the meal, the collard greens were over cooked and water logged and the ribs were over done as well. The meet was mush in the middle and chewy burnt on the outside look little flavor other than the sauce.   I would have rated it less but the staff and management noticed I had a problem with the meal and they were very apologetic and gave me a discount.  Nevertheless, I will give them another shot hopefully next time everything will be perfect!

0nf6FmBM7Vex6fMnP_G3Bg.text: Always such kind people! The food is typically amazing! My order gets messed up A LOT, but the quality of the food and the kind workers make up for it!!

pL3uOFqvLzKCLdLSfUhK8A.text: Went to this restaurant because I figured, it's been here awhile so it's got to be pretty good right? Wrong! The pulled pork was extremely dry! Without sauce it was very difficult to swallow. The brisket was probably the worst I've had anywhere!!! It came to the table with grill marks on! Who grills brisket??? The fat cap on it was so thick and chewy and there was absolutely no smoke ring.  I'm pretty sure it was cooked in the oven and taken out, sliced and grilled. The mac and cheese was "Stouffers" which our server readily admitted. The ribs were fairly decent, probably the best thing on the table aside from our appetizers (Sampler platter with fried pickles, mushrooms and cheese.)  I really wanted to like this restaurant but unfortunately we will not be back!

1ZgvfNLsG-A2X7dPgBxU4g.text: Unbeatable!!!! Delish!!!! Awesome food and great service!! Anytime we travel through, we wiil be SURE to stop at Lancaster's BBQ!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States. Beef Brisket and wings platter with mac n cheese and collards!!! Uhhhhmazing!!!!
Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States. Pork BBQ platter with BBQ beans and handcut fries!!
Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States. Whole fried okra!!!

9aNVNl9kWBqZ8DpiwwFa7w.text: Great place. Although judging a book by its cover we almost turned around. We enjoyed the barbelo wings as an appetizer. As well as the free hush puppies.

0zJ8edbs8EMKXcFEXKU7tw.text: This place was amazing. Delicious food, great, friendly service. Totally hit the spot for Eastern NC style BBQ. Both the chicken and the pork were phenomenal. The mac-n-cheese, and cheesy garlic bread are to die for. So much food.

DDnxVIrm54YF_wojU1mziw.text: Why would we drive all the way from Raleigh to get here? Let's start with some damn fine hush puppies and some of the best BBQ we've had. Period. The pulled pork is delicious, good and soft--and you have you choice of tangy BBQ sauces. And I'm a big fan of the fried chicken with the house's hot sauce. It makes a mess of your fingers and has plenty of zip.  Oh, and I'd three different parties of cops show up for lunch (like the last time we were here) you know you've got good eats.

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States. I&#39;m about to be soooooooo full.

pdBpQMTQZDAXx8ZQ77Gohg.text: Overpriced. Workers are not terribly friendly. Mac and cheese is unmemorable. The 'salad' selection is ice burg lettuce but shredded (like on a taco) instead of chucks-its strange. Almost like eating rabbit food.  If it wasn't the closest BBQ place I wouldn't waste my time/money. Try it, but have low expectations.

8O64TW-G6d5BHbCWFjY6Uw.text: Great pork BBQ and a nice selection of sides. Our server knew we were thinking about the beef brisket so she thoughtfully brought some for us to sample. Even though the pork was delicious, I may have to try the brisket next time because it was very good as well. We also enjoyed the hush puppies. The portions are large so be prepared to take leftovers home.

2Bu8b09mZhSRuN_s_W9zuQ.text: Due to the location, this place is a short stop for my parent's place and I have came here numerous times. And as a regular, so goes my dishes.  What I usually get and recommend (and I have tried):  1. Open face brisket.  Yes, this I think is their best dish that they offer. It comes with 4 briskets served on 2 buns covered in gravy, mushrooms, and onions. However, my parents, and sometimes I, think that the gravy could become a little too salty. But not to fret, ask the pretty waitress for it on the side and she will graciously oblige.   2. New Orleans Chicken.  Now this one is interesting. A little tangy, spicy, and some interesting flavors mixed in with the chicken topped off with mushrooms and onions with 2 sides and a piece of bread. To me, I thought the chicken was a little dry, but that goes with all grilled type of chicken in restaurants. I have yet to find a chicken dish where the meat is succulent and where all the juice comes flowing out when you bite in it.  3. Turkey Sandwich Great dish for lunch. Comes with tomatoes and lettuce, and a good portion of turkey. If you don't want something to fill you up to the top and give you the afternoon slumber this will be the dish that calls you.  I usually get something different every time I come here so it would be interesting. I still need to try their chicken sandwiches which is probably something I will get the next time I come here.

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States. Chick-a-que

W67czBaMlbp31FrH6J5Tbg.text: Signs and facades can be deceiving and Lancaster's BBQ is a case in point. I am from Kansas City and a BBQ enthusiast and I wanted so much to enjoy a great example of North Carolina barbecue. Sadly this wasn't it. There is no pit on site at this location and the food is brought in from the other location.  I ordered the BBQ Pork Dinner with sides of Brunswick Stew and Fried Whole Okra. The pulled pork arrived and I added the vinegar based sauce. The pork was mushy and tepid like it had been warmed quickly before  being served. My friend asked me if I wanted to taste his Brisket and I course I wanted too. It was funky for a guy who has tasted Championship Brisket and this looked as though it sat in the salamander all day waiting for some poor soul from Kansas City to play a cruel joke on.   The only reason it gets one star is that the Brunswick Stew was hearty, the fried okra was excellent and not greasy, but that was pretty much it.  Here is the way I think of it. Good BBQ takes time, love and pride on the part of the pit master. You need to respect the protein and put your best offering forward every time. There was no love put into this food whatsoever and it showed in the product and the lack of enthusiasm on the part if the staff. Something is not congruent with the reviews of this place and suspect there may be some cronyism going on...

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States
Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States

1RD_W-DMHHUJ2WcMAC4WBA.text: Beware a BBQ place where you don't smell smoke outside or in.  We were pretty underwhelmed my our dinner here.   The hush puppies were a nice start, and then we had wings.  The menu flavor we picked was "Jamaican honey" which just means some sort of generic, out of a bottle sweet and spicy sauce that was kind of haphazardly strewn on top of the wings.  They came with a side of fries, which were decent.  For the entree I had the brisket meal, it was ok.  Brisket was pretty tender but lots of fat.  Lots of fat.  That ended up going in an uneaten pile.  The fried okra were pretty good, but the mac and cheese was straight from a powder and not very good.  FH got the ribs, which he described as 'watery, as if they'd been boiled too long'. He didn't like them much. He had green beans, which were the old fashioned out of a can then boiled with a pork product style, and corn on the cob which was also not great per him.  I doubt we'll be back. I guess this type of place caters to a certain crowd, but it's not the kind of mouth watering amazing BBQ I want to eat when I'm in the mood for it.

02rOgEvEAGe0a4Fxw7CJ5w.text: Great food as usual. Server Kendall is a sweet young lady. All country and friendly. I got the Italian sausage and it could have been better. It's kind of bland a Spicer sausage selection would be wonderful. Will return again. Ole

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States

A3qmhjN9XtLe-rFA8KbkHQ.text: Absolutely great Q. Melt in your mouth pork. Love the fried okra, really good brisket. Good beer selection. Staff is hard working and efficient. Thank G for the take out.

LpAsjwqQDlwbVYD5UdOyJg.text: We went here because my husband wanted BBQ for his birthday and we were not disappointed! Great value and even better food! Hush puppies were delicious, and the Eastern NC style bbq pork was excellent! We will definitely be back!

oxlGY5b1pQiA7CFIQRqZ4Q.text: This used to be a good place with BBQ you would want.  Now it is not good.  BBQ tasted like it was made a week ago.

2m-5IRV4KxNtKCamxoEWog.text: Lancaster's got the fried pickles they was crispy like a tator chip. It's like the ruffles tator chip commercial u can't eat just one pickle lol. The wings was so go they try to fly away . They didn't want me to eat them .

7bdrYkYSbcGsGcKLfyQrzw.text: The food was good. We had pulled pork, Brunswick stew, green beans, Mac and cheese, baked beans, chips, and ribs. The Mac and cheese and baked beans were not our favorites. The service was lacking. All of the employees seemed not thrilled to be there. I ordered a water and didn't get one until the end of our meal, when I asked for one again. We ordered a garlic bread basket but we never got it. When our food was brought to the table, I noticed that I was given baked beans, but I had ordered green beans. The guy that brought our food out asked me if I was sure that I ordered green beans! Then he asked me a couple more times if I was sure that I wanted green beans. The portions were good sizes and most of the food we had was good, but they definitely need to work on improving their service if they want people to return.

qkzdP05GFVy7y0nUhfBPFw.text: Solid Eastern Carolina BBQ accompanied by good service in a casual, family-friendly atmosphere. The Pork Platter was excellent, as were the hush puppies that we ordered as an appetizer. My only complaint was the Mac & Cheese, which was overdone and a little dry. The bottled beer selection is impressive, although a few taps would be a nice addition. Not the best 'que in Mecklenburg County, but worth a stop if you're in the area.

D5-_zg6XFc88ig3C4buNnQ.text: Love Lancasters and the food was nice. The place was way to cold and the AC seemed to bounce off the walls.  The food was really good and the waitress was super nice though.

QgfJHT4_-LgBjC2w_-9iLg.text: First time there and both of us loved the food and service! Tried a couple combo plates for a taste of a few meats.  They were all great! But our  fav was the brisket.  I'll eat here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States

4oeDW681g_Yt7Z2t_ygKgQ.text: Amazing ribs and bbq, Service was great and speedy. Love both there locations. Try the redneck nachos or firecracker shrimp. And the hush puppies are to die for

6x5Wnmfhb6RSFgZCBIeDzg.text: If you like bbq & you like eastern nc style; check out Lancaster's.  I've never been disappointed.  On Friday you can do this special - pork plate w/ 2 sides & sweet tea for $8.00.  Such a good deal!  And they give you sooooo much food.   It's easily two, maybe three meals.     The service is great; I normally go with my work folks, about 8 people and they are always so accommodating.  Their customer service is some of the best around.   They bring all the sauces or "extras" you need, always make sure your drink is full; the basket of hushpuppies is full.  Very impressive.    The food is great too.  But I've never ventured out and tried anything other than the pork bbq (chopped).  But that vinegar sauce is real tangy.  The sides - mac & cheese, green beans, fries, homemade chips, fried WHOLE okra, corn, etc; all good.  I really cannot think of anything bad about this place.  The only thing I'd suggest is to open one up closer to me in south Charlotte.

DoNjN-XY7yCzk1tA5LP0jw.text: This place has pretty good food but management is horrific. They let employees talk to their co-workers like complete crap in front of customers like me. They watch it and let it happen. They let people work there that have harassed other people on the job and have broken health regulations and do nothing about it. All the managers care about is themselves and they make sure everyone knows they're the managers. They are rude themselves to their employees and speak to them inappropriately. I would never consider this place for a source of income. Most of the staff is very nice expect for the people who are only there because they personally know the managers. I will never visit this establishment again.

yFqQJTwrPNPvWsDxUFXo1g.text: Apparently, Southern BBQ is vastly different from Texan BBQ.  I was made aware of this when we stepped inside this friendly family joint.    The platter is a great deal and I love that they included hush puppies for free as a starter.    There are other BBQ places that I feel would be tastier, but since this was on the way home from the Latta Plantation, we just decided to give it a whirl.   This is a no frills type of place and local spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States
Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States

cjJ3m6_0WrbbLHxbhvWfgQ.text: The building was nice inside. Service was excellent. We had the sweet tea which was really really good! The Redneck Fries with Pork = excellent and a large portion. House salad = excellent. Pulled Pork and Rib Combo = a little pricy I though at $17, the Pork and ribs were great, the fries were good, the baked beans didn't appear to be any special house recipe. The little hushpuppy things they bring out when you first sit down and really good and a nice touch. If we are ever back in the area we will be back. Highly recommend!

QeJ6vj2eBvieAGEn6l9liw.text: Just passing through.  Good BBQ, fair price, friendly service.  The pulled pork was a good quality, well chopped, not much fat.  Plain pork and you choose your sauce.  Large portions and good sides.  Not the best bbq I have ever had, but I would definitely come back.  Was not impressed with the wings, pulled pork was much better.

kIJQD9l7oQqc3v5DzQxTNw.text: I was so hungry when we got to Lancaster's for an early dinner, I think at the time I was more pleased with the food than I would've been under normal circumstances. This review is in retrospect... Biggest atrocity of the meal: the Mac and cheese was Stouffer's! At a Southern BBQ joint, homestyle Mac should be a staple. Very disappointed by that. Next disappointment was the fried okra. In any "meat and three" type restaurant, the okra is chopped into bite sized pieces, then fried. Here, they just fry whole pieces of okra. Okra is a stringy, slimy vegetable. So while traditionally prepared fried okra is crisp and adheres well to its breading, Lancaster's shed its soggy breading on the first bite and you also have to deal with the stringy texture. Yuck.  The wings were ok, not as saucy as I like. A tourist would probably like the pork, but anyone familiar with Carolina BBQ would just deem it average.  Best part of the meal-Complimentary hush puppies starter.  Waitress was nice enough.

XTsfzLnYCAz3KpHzc0S7nw.text: Got the brisket and catfish combo with mashed potatoes and okra.  Despite getting take out and waiting.  We found it all to be Very good food!!

odf5pF5PkQyDQYGB_VpfEQ.text: Kudos to Lancaster's BBQ for categorizing their brisket as what it is: brisket, not BBQ.  Past that, though, there really was not much that I could enjoy about the place.  MENU: They have the random assortment of food that most BBQ places seem to have. Salad, burgers, and pretty much everything that no one goes to a BBQ place to eat, But hey, I guess people sometimes accidentally wander into here and forget it's a BBQ place.  FOOD: I got the pork, mac and cheese, and BBQ slaw. Hush puppies are served on the side. The pork was moist, but had no smokey flavor...or any flavor of any kind. They could have prepared this in the oven for all I know. The mac and cheese tasted good, but lacked any kind of originality whatsoever. Throw some bacon on it. Top it with some herbs. Use a unique cheese. Do something, anything to separate it from the stuff from the box. The BBQ slaw was good, but I was expecting a red slaw, not a yellow one, which is more traditional to NC.  SERVICE: If there is one thing that I hate, it's greedy management that cannot be bothered to hire enough waitstaff to tend to customers. As the customer, I should not have to wait for a refill, to get my bill, or to order just because management has decided to under-staff their restaurant. The server herself was actually fairly decent, though, towards the end she decided it was more important to talk to one of her friends who was dining there than it was to bring us our bill. She did come running over to make sure that she was tipped after I left some cash and left.  Overall, the place has potential if management would spend some time and effort on the menu and start properly staffing.

D6Pw272vFJ3q9kpchOim_A.text: Good Eastern Style NC BBQ  Took my wife to dinner tonight. She wanted to find the DMV and could not understand my directions so I took her for a test drive and Lancaster's was in the neighborhood.  I've been a couple of times but she has never been.  The atmosphere is country casual. Used to have a large amount of upscale biker traffic but now appears to more family or locals.  My wife went for a Salad that was served in a Taco Shell and topped with grilled chicken. I have a pork platter with BBQ Beans and Fries as sides.  Both were delicious.  This is a satelite location of the parent location in Mooresville.  They do a great job and I would recommend to anyone traveling through who is willng to take a few minutes and find the  location since they are a bit off of the beaten path.

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States
Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States

13iEau1zQxQTDM_yhiOBQA.text: Ordered from the bar and were promptly greeted by Bryson.  She took our orders, set up a couple brews, and brought a piping fresh batch of hushpuppies.  Mmm.  Then . . . the clock began to tick.  What seemed a long time, our entrees finally arrived.  I ordered the brisket reuben with okra, which was fine (although it needed more seasoning).  I especially liked the red cabbage slaw v. standard sauerkraut.  Lori opted for the 1/2 rack of ribs with a side of green beans and corn on the cob.  The ribs were good but the veggies did not deliver.  Bryson offered to make it right, but the damage was done.  They reminded us of everything wrong with school cafeteria food sitting in water and having its life drained away.  No, no, no.  Lancaster BBQ is a nice little business with everything going for them.  Details and consistency continue dog them, however.

dRvHs9y19nYnzgkb6jT1BA.text: I hate to penalize a restaurant too much on service but our waitress was lacking. We went in for a lunch and it took 1.5 hours but waitress seemed to be having a bad day.   BBQ was decent. Sides were pretty good. I'll give them another shot.

lq4ByiNS5NhMizqIQ7EwNg.text: Been here a lot over the years. Better menu and food has improved. Wait time for food is wonderful.  Server Chastity was sweet and very prompt. Will return. Ole  Second time to check in. David our server was very personable and fun to chat with. Everything was fast prompt and delicious as ever. Ole

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States. Part of Dining area

WxBjs_odNF999eEatGOpEA.text: How have I not been here till now? I've passed by this joint millions of times while taking my kids to school. They started at the elementary school across the street then onto the middle school further down the street and are now both in high school - again, down the street. And each morning and afternoon that I pass by, I make a mental note to stop in. But never do. Finally, after the hubs and I dropped off our kids for a high school game and were forbidden by the rugrats to attend with them (we're not cool enough, I guess) we decided to give It a try.   This place is split into two sections when you walk in. One side is a bar, some vintage arcade games and TVs for current sports. The other side is the sit down restaurant with two TVs that play old basketball games - think MJ circa 1980.   The menu is simple. All southern staples you'd expect including home made side dishes. They bring out complimentary hush puppies that were piping hot and delicious! Slightly sweet from the corn meal, It was a great starter. We ordered our meals along with more apps- chips and salsa and fried mushrooms. The salsa is home made and very flavorful. The mushrooms were freshly battered and deep fried. Didn't care too much for the mushrooms because It lacked salt and the breading got soft real fast but that's ok. Not bad for $4.   Now my meal. I chose the combo with fried chicken, bbq pork (gotta have bbq at a bbq joint!) along with green beans and collards. My $12 meal was HUGE! So much food. Definitely get your money's worth. The pork was tender and moist with a couple crunchy bits from the bbq char. Green beans were slow cooked with bacon so you get that Smokey taste in every bite. Collards were so good too! Pour on some hot sauce and vinegar and it's perfect. But the best part of It all? The fried chicken. This should be a chicken joint, not a bbq joint. That chicken SHINES!!! Deep fried to perfection, salty crispy light breading - the chicken here is like the exact replica of Price's which is saying a lot. No more bojangles run for me. Next time I want fried chicken, I'm coming here.   Customer service is also on point. Each waitress comes by to check on you at point or another. Looks like all the tables are shared, there's not one person assigned. Works for me because I can ask anyone for anything and I get It right away.   The fried mushrooms weren't great and the sides lacked a bit of salt but overall, this place has earned a new regular in me.

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States. Combo plate - that chicken tho! Sooooo good
Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States. Fried mushrooms
Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States. Chips and homemade salsa

mBi4zZsGNODedjwP2TrG-w.text: I will never forget the first time I visited my sister when she moved to Huntersville to Charlotte.  I mean, when she lived in Charlotte, we made 2 turns from her house and would end up in "Uptown" Charlotte.  Now, it consists of pulling off the highway, take this road for a few miles, and then that road, and then avoid the horses that may be on the road.  Needless to say, two different styles of living!  With that being said, I was on the way and just saw a bunch of houses, and then randomly, a BBQ joint, next to a martial houses/concealed carry class house.  It was quite interesting, but I knew in the back of my head this place had to special.  So, I have decided to stop here a few times over the years- and most recently last weekend with my family.  It can get pretty busy, but they do a good job keeping tables moving and there is a lot of seating here.  The servers are friendly too.  There are a few TVs to watch sports and they have merch for sale too.  The menu, it has a few things on here, and just by looking at the food come out of the kitchen, I noticed two things- the salads are served in HUGE shells, and the burgers are big size too.  But, when I am in North Carolina, I always go for the pork, or the ribs.  This time, I stuck with the pork platter.  While you wait, you get some decent hush puppies to snack on.  They have 2 different types of sauces, along with Texas Pete.  I like putting the thicker sauce on the hush puppies.  When the food came (which came pretty quickly), I couldn't wait- since its been a while that I have had Carolina pork (I usually get ribs).  Now, what I do, I like to mix all three sauces on top of the pork, and it just gave it this robust kick in my mouth- it was pretty solid explosion of flavors!  The collards had a nice zing too.  Honestly, the least memorable part was the Brunswick stew, but I am very picky when it comes to that.  I think my plate was like $11 for all of that.  We got conned into getting dessert, so I got a thing of banana pudding.  It was a nice lil cup size just enough to get me sugar dizzy.  I liked the crunch and the creaminess in there.    From my sisters house, I think this may be one of the closest places to get food (at least I know it is when travelling south on Beatties Ford)- and that is not a bad problem to have.  Need to make more visits here and get my pork fix!

vhX7f-jHL5ih1peah6N7gw.text: Fried pickles and hush puppies are great. Service is good and the wings are up to snuff.  If they have it, try the Bold Rock Cider.  It's very crisp and delicious and local...

QyfFCDDUmLKrhmrXqZm5Jw.text: This is right around the corner from the house and thank goodness!! They have great barbecue and sides. I recently discovered the Hawaiian chicken salad in a taco shell bowl with a delicious teriyaki glaze, pineapple slice and barbecue chicken. Try it with ranch dressing and see if you can keep from eating the entire taco shell bowl. My husband can't enough of the wings and pulled pork combo. He's always game for whatever is on special and their chicken tenders with a double side of okra is one of my favorites. Great local beer selection and local patrons. You never know who you'll run into. Always be nice to your bartenders and make a new friend if you're there alone.

NmT7A70FZZj4SyX6RIiIFA.text: We visited for the first time today, and it was good! The sides could stand to be a bit bigger... my coleslaw was in a teeny cup, but everything tasted good, was hot, and served fast. Thank you!

UDhFjUiUCCXb2GSNHOsAqw.text: So I'm new to Carolina BBQ but I'm not new to knowing good food from bad. We have tried this place twice and it seems like it's a bit underrated. The food is very home style with simple decor and plastic plates. This isn't a date night but great for families.   The first impression is always positive from the staff. The next welcome is with these fried cornbread things that really make you hungry. They are also nice to try all of the sauces on the table.   We've tried a few things here and the redneck nachos along with the chicken tenders are the highlights. Dang those nachos.... with the brisket... and melted cheese... oh dang! These are also fun since you can pick your meat and cheese option (we did brisket and cheddar).  The chicken tenders seem to be made in house, no overly seasoned breading here!  The BBQ'd meats have been good. The brisket is juicy and has a good flavor. The chicken is also a win.   As for sides, we've really liked everything expect the Mac and cheese. The okra, collards, and slaw can jump on my plate anyway!
