LlHJU3yeqeI7M6E5TjHDjQ.text: I am really impressed with this restaurant. The  food is very good  and the portions are very large! The staff is always kind and prompt and the prices are reasonable.

jqtV37ilzcPhwPyU6oKxdw.text: Great bbq pork here. Tasty juciy, not too much grease very powerful  air conditioning in a hot day.

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States

XNwMsUFDo4FWPjM0R1sahg.text: Their Beef Brisket is not good at all.  It's more like a regular roast not like brisket. It's actually on the dry side too not juicy like it's suppose to be! The food is just regular nothing exciting, sorry!

QObno-FZwvNkZtgJZd1_kg.text: I can't believe that I haven't reviewed this delicious gem. The food here is full of flavor. The service can be kinda bad at times, but the food is always worth it. I am addicted to the barbalo wings! The pork plate is great with the house bbq. The pork chops are good, the onion rings are worth it, and the sides are home-made goodness. Make sure to stop and eat at this Huntersville bbq joint; it's a must try!  Food Taste: 10  Food Temp.: 9  Order Accuracy: 10  Speed of Service: 7  Server Attentiveness: 7  Host Friendliness: 9  Environment: 10  Cleanliness: 10  Restroom Clean: 9

GicuCxmc5ygFAQgZwPXYjg.text: The to go specials are decent... but just given the prices and quality of food, so many other places that are better than this place.  Been here a couple times, everytime it's gotten worse.

_UCpoP_rS0m6elGZOHwZoQ.text: The location is easy to miss because the outside isn't anything special. The service is always good because the people and nice and helpful.  This is Eastern Carolina BBQ. The pulled pork is my favorite in Charlotte. Now onto the fried chicken. The chicken is cooked to order so you will have to wait for it about 15 minutes. However I promise you that it is worth the wait. You can have the fried chicken plain or dipped. I suggest you DIP it. The only time I don't dip it is when I have take-out, which means the dip is on the side. When you order the fried chicken dipped there are three heat level options. The chicken is crispy and juicy every time and I only do the white meat. The fried chicken remains crispy even after it is dipped. Some places once they dip it it goes soggy. I believe they maintain the crispness because each piece is freshly fried and then dipped. This means the dip is part of the cooking process.  The hushpuppies are good and additive. The sides are tasty as well. They always have some type of specials which may differ if dining in or taking out. There is also a separate bar. As you can see I will return.

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States
Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States

QOIBsAFMTHFdFivtmmaX3g.text: Went on a Friday night around 6p and it was not all that busy in the dining room but the bar was buzzing...literally.  Barby had her usual, half rack of ribs.  I decided to switch up and have the beef brisket...oh my, so good and a really nice size portion too. I add the brunswick stew and the BBQ beans. I do like that the brunswick stew is a side dish here, it's really quite tasty.  Wow, what a great meal...so much I had to get a go box.

E3L5y4qSG8HG8uo129MdKQ.text: Lancaster's catered my home wedding reception in March- they delivered, brought everything inside and set it up which was great. For the price of bbq and hush puppies it was a great deal. All my guests loved the food

7jWkjsi09MIJZmhB8zzLlg.text: The food was absolutely 100% amazing!!!! The staff was out of this world!!!! Good atmosphere. The ribs are killer, onion rings kicked butt, garlic bread was on point!!! The fried corn on the Cobb was something we have never seen before and we will never eat regular corn again!!!! Please do yourselves a favor and go eat here or the one in Mooresville.

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States

meV3olyd6UOB8_O8pBeJaw.text: Lancaster's has been around for a long time and it is a local favorite. We don't come here often only when we just have a taste for some seafood. Quite frankly, it's my opinion that they have gone down a bit in terms of the quality of their food over the years. I seem to recall that the fish fillets were better tasting and better seasoned years ago. I seem to recall that the portions were larger too. It seems like now that they've gotten more popular they just kind of throw things together. It's still good food. But if there were other options in the area for good fried seafood I would check them out.

yAgNeneknt1F-LYMzNaQkw.text: Food is simply phenomenal! I have been here many times and every time the food is perfect.   Don't get me wrong this is not healthy food but its ok to splurge now and then.  The hush puppies are fantastic, great beer selection, the wings are the best I had around Charlotte.   This hidden gem is worth the trip!

PFSgW0vjcN8Tu03G1OV10A.text: Lancaster's is certainly one of our staples. We eat there probably once every two weeks, as it's just five minutes from our home. Given the frequency of our take out orders, it's clear we like this place. Great barbecue, fried chicken, ribs, hush puppies, fried pickles and mushrooms. Even the cobb salad served in the fried shell is delicious (ask for the grilled chicken to be dipped in bbq sauce). And until very recently, they had the best dill potato salad you'll ever find. It's the new recipe change for their potato salad that prevents me from giving them 4 stars. Why change something that isn't broken? Their original potato salad was distinctive because it contained a strong dill flavor, and it may or may not have contained finely diced pickles. The flavors were so unique, and obviously, delicious.   For some reason, the owner has decided to change the recipe to a bland, dill-less, potato salad. My spouse was stunned when he ordered 2 quarts ($20, so not cheap) for his office's Christmas potluck (as he had done for multiple office potlucks over the years). Several noticed the change, and the response was overwhelmingly negative. They too had all come to love the unique, dill potato salad.  I'm sure we'll keep eating at Lancaster's. I'll just have to find a new side. Because the new recipe is not cutting it.

XWrzd19SIE5RPqioLpstkA.text: Very solid NC Style BBQ - down to earth place with nice people.  Eat everything, you'll like a lot of it.

jb5BeHQ43dojC7aKPl4kbQ.text: The bbq is excellent... I ordered the Catfish Platter that included hush puppies, two sides: ( BBQ beans and mac n cheese ), and two good size fried battered catfish fillets. Perfectly seasoned and very tasty. The sweet tea sounded good, but I ordered water instead. This was my first time here and I would definitely go back again. Would recommend to anyone!!!

n_8dmqdGcai_p16Vf5e1Rw.text: Came here on a Friday night, busy but we got seated right away. They give you a basket of hot hush puppies when you order entrees before your meal, just be careful not to fill up on them :). I ordered the pork BBQ/ fried chicken platter with mashed potatoes and gravy and macaroni and cheese. The pork BBQ was very good... And the BBQ sauce they have at the table is delicious- not too tangy and not too sweet. The fried chicken was a little overcooked, but decent. The sides I had were good overall, and they have over 10 sides to choose from. My meal was around $11 and I could only finish half of it. My boyfriend ordered the rib and chicken wing platter. He said the ribs were pretty good, but the wings were some of the best he's ever had. We shared the banana pudding for dessert- one word: AMAZING. I'd come back for the food, the service from our server was nothing special though. Se even gave us our bill before asking if we wanted anything else or if we wanted to see a dessert menu... So we had to ask her to add dessert to our bill.

photos.caption: Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States. Rib and chicken wing platter (collard greens and potato salad on the side)
Photo of Lancaster's BBQ - Huntersville, NC, United States. Pork BBQ and fried chicken platter

vAPSRtQPKwOwFqgP2wL7Yw.text: Went there on Saturday night.  They weren't exceptionally busy, there was no wait and tables available, but they did have a decent crowd.  The service was VERY slow.  Once we were seated, it took over 8 minutes for the waitress to even say hi, and take our drink order.  We weren't in a hurry so that by itself wasn't an issue, but the slow, inattentive service continued.  We ordered the bbq plate and the half chicken plate.  The bbq and chicken were both good.   Neither was the best I've had, but both good.  The sides on the other hand were a whole lot of meh.  Between the service and sides, you can do better at other BBQ places in the area.

EWoC20RR4PI0JeHY63CEaA.text: If you want some good old southern fried food, this is your place. Service is quick and efficient. Orders are always correct. Fried pickles, fried shrooms, and the blt are pretty good! If you're from the south, you will find something you like here!

5GP8K-3wArKZroOMJ4qOlg.text: My husband and I usually love this place. The last time we went a few weeks ago on a Friday night the BBQ was undercooked and the waitresses seemed to be more interested in gossiping than doing their job. Hopefully next time we go it will be a better experience. It might be awhile.

UkhYHAtWB2MrhyUZUgAqMA.text: I'll start by saying that my family loves this place. I, however only go there when they make me. I feel like the food is overpriced for it not to be amazing. Each time I go I try something different and I have yet to leave feeling like what I paid was worth what I had just consumed. It's not horrible though. It may just be me because like I mentioned before, my family loves it.

EG0-uJyMHk0IFBKfFhh4-g.text: So after a day hiking around Latta Plantation, I passed by this place on the way to the park and decided to stop in when I was going home and I glad I did stop.  The place is cute....and the dining area almost windowless.....(NOTE:  can anyone tell me why most BBQ places in NC have either tiny windows or no windows at all??????)  The bar is where I ate and was bright and had plenty of seating.  The bartender gave me a menu and I ordered a small BBQ plate with chips.  Small was a lot of food and as for the chips...if you have someone with you just get 1 order as there are a ton of them and enough for two people to eat.  I got the cajun chips though I couldn't tell the spice was on them.  The BBQ was very good and the Eastern sauce was even better.  Throw in a few beers and this place would be 5 stars if they just had an outdoor eating area vs. just a place to smoke.

A9eN7GJ7X4O9hr0mUpCCaQ.text: Everything was inviting and delicious.  Every plate that passes you to another person's  table will make your mouth water. The hush puppies at the best I've ever had. Don't fill up on them.  Don't be afraid to try any of there sides.

5hrhhEZnoOilfnc_HCmmJA.text: BEST BBQ in CHARLOTTE! I love their deep fried pickles and hush puppies. Their ribs are fall of the bone amazing! We always get the 5 pork sandwiches and a side of mac n cheese. If you get the chicken tenders be sure to ask for the Bang Bang sauce, spicy and delicious!

kTx8NzVpKuprFyRbLFoNow.text: This place is all hype. I met a friend here after googling good bbq in the area. This place came up. What a lie! The bbq is sub par - served on paper plates etc. Just a horrible environment back woods crappy hole in the wall. I love a good dive but, the food has to be good! MAC Speedshop has way better bbq than this place by far!

rs41LKFK8maEUNll5cRpZw.text: Decided to tryout local BBQ place based on positive reviews. Got pork dinner, Mac and cheese, and BBQ slaw. Not a very good meal at all. Pork was sticky and slimy. Mac and cheese tasted processed and BBQ slaw had no flavor.

XlDMu7V7w8XRwb8WR5k47A.text: It's not the best BBQ in NC or even in Charlotte, but it is good, and close to home, so that makes me a fan!  It draws a very different crowd from its NASCAR-themed sister in Mooresville, but the food seems pretty much the same, and the service is always very good.

8blYaSTGZKPUAjlu1L4H5w.text: Best brisket EVER!! Love love this place. If you like great food, great customer service and reasonable prices, this will become a weekly haunt. Great hush puppies, sweet tea, everything is awesome here!

HepGrqklHDgd4i4SQdj-Dw.text: Dry meat, mediocre sweet tea, 75 cents a slice for bread, run of the mill sauce, vinegar sauce that is just vinegar.  i think i've had better bbq sandwiches at KFC

AdiR2jOsVpAvcu2XnYv5CA.text: Good food but the service is a little shabby.

b9koY_XAblgHn2plUumxew.text: Great food, great service, and great ambiance for a BBQ joint. I highly recommend visiting Lancaster's to satisfy your BBQ craving!

3Db4dGLrjLUySKwaPJfKCQ.text: We came across this delicious BBQ joint hiding on our way to the Latta Plantation Equestrian center. Ten bucks got me a Pork plate with two sides. BBQ was very good, but my sides were just alright. Brunswick stew just wasn't very hearty or flavorful. Not that i order it all the time, but it's the first time i've ever seen it served on a plate and not in a cup or bowl. My other side was the mashed potatoes and gravy which were a little better.   They start you off with a nice basket of hush puppies which were pretty tasty. Always a bonus when i get food just for sitting down. We ordered the fried mushrooms before we knew hush puppies were coming, but i'm glad we did. They were served with ranch and done just right in a way where the mushroom didn't just fall out of it's fried shell when you take a bite. It was a great value for the half basket ($3).  The location is not that far from from the Northlake Mall area, but far enough away that i'm not sure we'll end up here again.

XGUesUDBDxD9sBMy6t6rxw.text: This quaint little BBQ spot is right across the street from my old elementary school and used to be Puckett's, and old gas station and convenience store. Lancaster's has okay food. I've had wings here before that were okay. On my last visit, I had fish n'chips. The fish was way too oily and almost melted in my mouth. Only M&M's should do that. Not fish. I also had whole fried okra. Kind of hard to mess up okra. I can't recommend that you try the BBQ because I personally have not had any. But, if you happen to be in the area, check it out.

2koxmvw4_AUvPIE5OT-IaA.text: Very cool decor...  great bbq..  had pork dinner..  brunswick stew, and fries.  Hushpuppies were really good as well.  Beer selection lacking.

wK1Yqz2he6LBGlLMq7mjgA.text: This place is great!  The staff in the bar and at the pick up counter are super friendly.  The wings are out of this world.  They are cooked and sauced perfectly.  The cajun fried pickles are so delicious.  I could eat a whole order myself. (okay, maybe I did.)  I found this place at the end of my stay in NC, which is a blessing and a curse.  I missed trying other stuff, but my waistline didn't have to pay for it!   A great southern meal, with great southern hospitality. :)

YkmLztphz3uvsCQC8CIQ0w.text: I've now been here twice thanks to my lovely bestie and her hubby.  We had been here already the first time I visited Charlotte and we were all planned to go to another restaurant that we saw on Diner, Drive-Ins and Dives, but they were closed on Sundays and Mondays and well, it was Sunday.    The staff was great.  Super nice.    Hush Puppies are complementary while you wait for your food.  I got a combo plate with 1/4 Fried Chicken and BBQ Brisket.  Yum.  The fried chicken was crispy and moist.  It was very simple coating, probably just flour, salt and pepper.  Nothing special.  The brisket was great.  I don't think I even went to grab for the sauce.  Just ate it with what it came with.  My friends loved their food too.  Prices are pretty decent.

kPwv4UgrBx14ernMquxWrA.text: The brisket was overcooked and reheated. Not the best or even ok. Liked the live music. Wouldn't go again to eat!

IsapgPG9HQdpO1wLi6wNHw.text: Yum! Hush puppies come to table in place of bread! So good.  BBQ pulled pork dinner with potato salad and onion rings for husband. Comes marinated and you pick your hot or sweet sauce at table. Marinade has tiny kick to it- sweet sauce is amazing.  Maui chicken salad for me - perfectly grilled chicken and grilled pineapple with teriyaki.  Best, though, was waitress! Very helpful with suggestions and really listened to what we said! We found on yelp driving from Atlanta to NY and may never come this way again, but just saying we decided that's it's worth the couple of miles off of I-485 to eat here.

aU88EtXgcl4p0vTgsHUHvw.text: Only good thing here is the waitress. The barbecue is not real barbecue. I've had both real North Carolina BBQ and Texas barbecue. the brisket was tough and obviously precooked somewhere, and then grilled almost no smoke ring and no smoke flavor. Yes the brisket slices had grill marks on them, unreal. the barbecue ribs were obviously boiled prior to being put on the smoker. there was a little smoke flavor to them and a lot of Grill char on them. this was not North Carolina BBQ or any real slow cook BBQ. I should have heeded the advice on Yelp very poor smoked meat. the only real treat where the free hush puppies. If you want North Carolina BBQ, or any slow cook BBQ you better go somewhere else.

XXVETrawG_W7BXsdZORU2g.text: Best Carolina barbeque in town. Two types of sauces at the table for you - Tangy, flavorful, and spicy, or sweet with a bite. The hush puppies were unreal - best I've ever had! Too bad my waistline can't afford to go often!  The only downside is the wait. the food is a little slow, but it's so worth it.

5lIYRfhmPKRfsM_R2CHH1w.text: A local staple.  Great food, service, and environment.  We go to Lancaster's for family events fairly often and it never disappoints.  It's the perfect place for a cold beer, great BBQ, and a laid back atmosphere.  I also often will buy pork to go just to have through the week, and sometimes freeze for later.    Definitely no better option within miles and miles!

ckPhFj8-N_FH0S9eoTr-Rg.text: We go to Lancaster's very frequently.  Love the restaurant, bar, and ALL of the staff.  Everyone is always so prompt to serve you and so friendly.  The food is great.  We have never had a bad meal.  The service is fantastic and very attentive to your needs and desires.  The bar is a great place to "hang out".  It is always full of a lot of local people who are friendly and it is always nice to spend an evening there.  Anyone that frequents this location will definitely agree with me.

eICTAZoux9ljNwafewrl6g.text: Stopped in for a to go. The BBQ is pretty good, but the service is terrible. They sent me to the bar to place my order, no kidding the bar-tender turned her back on me as soon as I walked in. She started talking with her co-worker who was eating. I waited a few minutes, the did the ol' hello! She never smiled, never even said hello. Simply stared at me....no smile, just stare! I placed my order, waited and she brought it out, and NEVER said one more word, not even when I paid 14.00 for a plate of BBQ, 1 oz of slaw, 4 hush puppies, and three cold onion rings. First and last time visiting lancasters BBQ. And this is one BBQ eating boy.....

G5nKNnI5tKQEtoWi_Sz7yA.text: Restaurant is nice, servers are friendly.  I got the pork dinner.  Meat was mushy.  Coleslaw was ok.  Mashed potatoes were not bad.  French fries were nothing to brag about.  Smothered chicken was nothing special either.   If you are passing by and need a bite, this place will work.  If you are on a quest for really good BBQ, I would keep going.

BuC_Qcj9IF5ndl2HOL1iEQ.text: Always love to watch waitstaff hold up counters as they eat their dinner in front of me. Nat's flying around. Vacuum cleaners plugged in in the dining room. The manager who brought my beer actually asked my four year old if it was for him. How inappropriate. We often visit this restaurant and have not ever had an issue. After tonight we will not be back for sometime.

knv2Y17DXCLf9byXXKkVrQ.text: Had colleagues from Europe in town recently.  Two different groups during back to back weeks.  Not far from our offices so it was the easy choice.  I've been here several times before and knew this would be a safe bet to give them a taste of Carolina Q without having to go far after a long day at work.  First group was last week and 4 of us sampled a wide variety of offerings from the menu.  They thought the fried pickles were the strangest thing they had ever seen on a menu and had to try them. They could not stop eating them and raving about how good they were.  (I like them too)  Thoroughly impressed with the BBQ across the board as I knew they would be. A great time was had by all.  Well the second group comes into town this week and yes, had heard all about the food/experience from the first group and insisted we had to go.  And the fried pickles were the first thing that asked about and ordered.  Again, a great meal and overall experience was had by all.  I guess this has now become a regular spot for whenever they come over for a visit.  As I said above, I have been here before and Lancaster's is on my "regular rotation" of BBQ spots.  I've never been disappointed.  Very casual with good food and always great service.   Prices are very reasonable too.  Check it out.

ytU_QXY8bX6FX3g9k1fAbA.text: Decent BBQ & close to where I live.  The vinegar based sauce is delicious & has a little spicy kick to it.  The mustard slaw is very good and so are the hush puppies.  If you have room for dessert, I definitely recommend the banana pudding----out of this world!  YUM

8Q8Upic-_ih2KE-_00cvRw.text: Ate here twice, pretty full and happy both times. Hush puppies were delish. I got a turkey Ruben. It was good but a little dry. I think the portions could've been bigger too. The bbq was good and the fried pickles and okra were yummy. Pretty good beer selection. Staff is very friendly and helpful. I would come back but I think they should step it up a notch.

uuK3-dac6GGP3Z8EfQ5S9w.text: Dipped chicken was out of this world. Must have if your there. The service was a little slow but not bad. The atmosphere is very casual. I would definitely come back.

WvLYaRThVRCEa3wRRj9xIw.text: Great food for a decent price. They treat you like you are a part of their family. There is a large dining area and a seperate bar area so you can choose to be in the noise or not. I've always experienced great service.

W0OF15l-2Lc6MzZ8akyiFA.text: We ordered a brisket dinner and a "jumbo" brisket sandwich as take out from here so I can only comment on these two dishes and not on their service. The brisket slices are chewy and have actual grill marks on the flat sides, which tells me that it didn't spend much time in a smoker for the fat to render and was probably cooked/reheated on a grill and then covered in sauce. I think that violates more than a few BBQ rules around prep and flavor.....The "jumbo" brisket sandwich we ordered is nothing more than three slices of brisket between some buttered toast with some slaw throw on for some odd reason. Not how I would prepare or present a "jumbo" sandwich. Also, the collard greens were downright bad. I know that brisket is not really a strong point of Carolina BBQ, so I might give this place another chance to try the pork. Otherwise I'll probably look elsewhere for BBQ.

Pa5_hlBbfasjLAflWOLUzQ.text: In the mood for some tasty BBQ so I headed here for lunch. The place is clean and spacious. They gave us a basket of hush-puppies and they were the best I've ever tasted. I ordered the special: pork and 5 wings plus 2 sides for $9. I asked for all flats, extra wet for the wings. I got mostly flats but no sauce. They were still good even without the sauce. Our waitress, Jayme, was top-notch: super friendly and very attentive. She brought me some sauce and kept the refills coming. The pork was very tasty. I ordered onion rings and homemade potato chips for my sides and they were excellent! My hubby ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich and Mac 'n cheese. He said they were okay. He didn't care for the Mac 'n cheese because it tasted like velveeta. Next time, I'll try the brisket. I highly recommend.

jTVwnUCWLpCvNz5DiOG-fg.text: I'd say this place is a little pricey and not in the best are/location, however the food is very good and I like their concept, walk-in-drive thru and a dinning area with an old gas pump.

pxOI9Trg3x0sGb7BUcznnw.text: After a visit to the 2nd Annual NC Brewers & Music Festival, we happened to see this little BBQ place and decided to give it a try.  We were glad we did!  There were a few regulars & families eating in the restaurant seating area, as well as the separate bar area.  After looking over the extensive menu, hubby opted for the fried mushroom appetizer, and the bbq plate w/chicken wings & mac & cheese.  I had the chopped bbq sandwich & fries (extra crispy).  The sandwich was so big I took half home!  Loved the option of 2 different sauces as well.  The service was delightful and friendly, with your typical small southern town clientele.  Loved the complimentary hush puppies too!  Definitely stop in this place if you're in the area, or feel like a nice drive outside of Charlotte for some good BBQ and company.
